name.text: 7.2.6.2 Task: Which of the matrix products are defined

questiontext.text:
Consider the following matrices: \[A={@matrixa@}, B={@matrixb@}, C={@matrixc@}\]

For each row in the table below, state whether the given product is defined by choosing "true" or "false" from the drop-down list, and if it is defined, then state the size (\(n\times m\)) of the product. (If it is not defined, then you should just leave those boxes blank.)

Product Defined? Size (if defined)?
\(AB\)[[input:ans11]][[validation:ans11]][[input:ans121]][[validation:ans121]]\(\times\)[[input:ans122]][[validation:ans122]][[feedback:row1]]
\(BA\)[[input:ans21]][[validation:ans21]][[input:ans221]][[validation:ans221]]\(\times\)[[input:ans222]][[validation:ans222]][[feedback:row2]]
\(BC\)[[input:ans31]][[validation:ans31]][[input:ans321]][[validation:ans321]]\(\times\)[[input:ans322]][[validation:ans322]][[feedback:row3]]
\(CB\)[[input:ans41]][[validation:ans41]][[input:ans421]][[validation:ans421]]\(\times\)[[input:ans422]][[validation:ans422]][[feedback:row4]]
\(CA\)[[input:ans51]][[validation:ans51]][[input:ans521]][[validation:ans521]]\(\times\)[[input:ans522]][[validation:ans522]][[feedback:row5]]
\(AC\)[[input:ans61]][[validation:ans61]][[input:ans621]][[validation:ans621]]\(\times\)[[input:ans622]][[validation:ans622]][[feedback:row6]]
\((AB)C\)[[input:ans71]][[validation:ans71]][[input:ans721]][[validation:ans721]]\(\times\)[[input:ans722]][[validation:ans722]][[feedback:row7]]
\(A(CB)\)[[input:ans81]][[validation:ans81]][[input:ans821]][[validation:ans821]]\(\times\)[[input:ans822]][[validation:ans822]][[feedback:row8]]

generalfeedback.text:
Recall that the product \(XY\) of two matrices \(X\) and \(Y\) is only defined if the number of columns of \(X\) is equal to the number of rows of \(Y\). In that case, if \(X\) is \(n \times p\) and \(Y\) is \(p \times m\), then \(XY\) is an \(n \times m\) matrix.

Product Defined? Size (if defined)?
\[ \begin{matrix} A & B \\ ({@sizea[1]@}\times{@sizea[2]@}) & ({@sizeb[1]@}\times{@sizeb[2]@}) \end{matrix}\] \[{@ta11@}\] \[{@feedbackFunction(ta12)@}\]
\[ \begin{matrix} B & A \\ ({@sizeb[1]@}\times{@sizeb[2]@}) & ({@sizea[1]@}\times{@sizea[2]@}) \end{matrix}\] \[{@ta21@}\] \[ {@feedbackFunction(ta22)@}\]
\[\begin{matrix} B & C \\ ({@sizeb[1]@}\times{@sizeb[2]@}) & ({@sizec[1]@}\times{@sizec[2]@}) \end{matrix}\] \[{@ta31@}\] \[{@feedbackFunction(ta32)@}\]
\[\begin{matrix} C & B \\ ({@sizec[1]@}\times{@sizec[2]@}) & ({@sizeb[1]@}\times{@sizeb[2]@}) \end{matrix}\] \[{@ta41@}\] \[{@feedbackFunction(ta42)@}\]
\[\begin{matrix} C & A \\ ({@sizec[1]@}\times{@sizec[2]@}) & ({@sizea[1]@}\times{@sizea[2]@}) \end{matrix}\] \[{@ta51@}\] \[{@feedbackFunction(ta52)@}\]
\[\begin{matrix} A & C \\ ({@sizea[1]@}\times{@sizea[2]@}) & ({@sizec[1]@}\times{@sizec[2]@}) \end{matrix}\] \[{@ta61@}\] \[{@feedbackFunction(ta62)@}\]
\[\begin{matrix} (A & B) & C \\ ({@sizea[1]@}\times{@sizea[2]@}) & ({@sizeb[1]@}\times{@sizeb[2]@}) & ({@sizec[1]@}\times{@sizec[2]@}) \end{matrix}\]\[{@ta71@}\] \[{@feedbackFunction(ta72)@}\]
\[\begin{matrix} A & (C & B) \\ ({@sizea[1]@}\times{@sizea[2]@}) & ({@sizec[1]@}\times{@sizec[2]@}) & ({@sizeb[1]@}\times{@sizeb[2]@}) \end{matrix}\] \[{@ta81@}\] \[{@feedbackFunction(ta82)@}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Since you think the product is defined, you must enter the size (\(n\times m\)). (No penalty incurred by this submission.)
Since you think the product is defined, you must enter the size (\(n\times m\)). (No penalty incurred by this submission.)
